column4: i tried to resize the 1st partition on my usb-flash/stick/memory (/dev/sdb) and would've liked to create a second one, but gparted complains: http://paveaani.dyndns.org/gparted_details.htm i've got billix on this stick and have done: 'install-mbr -p1 /dev/sdb' and 'syslinux -s /dev/sdb1' ...any other ways to create a second partition on usb-memorystick?
pastebin english please. we can#t read that
yes you can, the lines in finnish aren't relevant...that's the standard output from my gparted. i'm sorry that part of it is in deed in finnish
then make it english
we don't support DSL or anything else but ubuntu
well my problem is on gparted _in_ ubuntu
your mkfs was wrong and made a booboo
any idea how to solve that?
redo the filesystem. is the fs really fat?
please answer me
fat16 it claims to be
I don't ask you what it claims to be but what is IS
linux partitions where linux itself is installed as fat is very very rare
file -s <dev file of usb partition>
mount says vfat, gparted says fat16
don't mount it when you use gparted. delete the partition again. make the filesystem under windows that should fix it.
it's fat (16bit), haven't got any windows (argh!) :(
use freedos maybe? if you can
or make the partition in gparted?
delete sdb1 and make a new one? i hope it doesn't turn this thing into waste.
the mkfs command you used before made a fat that windosw won't like according to gparted
that's the partition that came on this stick i just bought today :) just added mbr to it...
